meanings.sent1: Some people allege things that are not true.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer will allege that the defendant is innocent.
meanings.sent3: I allege that my cat is secretly a superhero.
meanings.sent4: She will allege that the sun is a giant ball of fire.
meanings.sent5: The detective alleged that the butler was the culprit.

meanings.definition: To state as a fact but without proof.
meanings.sent1: He likes to allege things without any evidence.
meanings.sent2: The tabloid will allege scandalous stories about celebrities.
meanings.sent3: I allege that unicorns roam the forest at night.
meanings.sent4: The conspiracy theorist will allege that aliens walk among us.
meanings.sent5: The student alleged that the dog ate his homework.

meanings.sent1: She will allege that she saw a ghost in the attic.
meanings.sent2: The politician will allege that his opponent is corrupt.
meanings.sent3: I allege that my lucky socks bring me good luck.
meanings.sent4: The fortune teller will allege that a great fortune awaits you.
meanings.sent5: The child alleged that monsters live under the bed.
